changes.text: I have a set of extensions I make extensive use of and even written my own theme available on the marketplace.

Some experience using tools like Tensorflow, Keras to implement neural networks for image classification, text generation and image generation using GAN approach. Mostly due to my deeplearning and AI nanodegree in Udacity.

I am using node since 2014 and have used it daily since. My main uses are web applications, serverless functions and smaller scripts/tools. I am familiar with latest JS features and event driven programming.

In 2015 I started building a larger project with node and also lead an increasing team of developers. Around the time that node started to mature and come around with LTS plans it seemed like a perfect fit to invest more heavily into the language.

I started building larger side projects and familiarize myself with the node ecosystem by building my own (first private) packages.
My first contact with node was while developing a prototype for a connected vehicle at work.

5CuUP8UOcmcPLLGbfy62.title: Node.JS
5CuUP8UOcmcPLLGbfy62.description: My go-to language for building solutions on cloud platforms, web solutions (like devradar) or CLIs is currently node due to its huge ecosystem of libraries that makes it super easy to build new things.

changes.text: Through the Udacity Artificial Intelligence program I refreshed my knowledge in data analytics and got introduced to current level of the art tools in the Python ecosystem.

One of the main tasks in my job as function developer was to identify patterns in data and explain system behavior in certain situations. My main tool to do this was Matlab with a self-developed framework for data handling, evaluation and visualization.
My latest project is [plantbuddy](https://github.com/anoff/plantbuddy) which is actually based on the nodeMCU chip but also programmed using the Arduino IDE.

Interested in self driving cars I started building my own based platform named [robby5](https://github.com/anoff/robby5) based on cheap components and a hybrid setup between Arduino and Raspberry Pi for controlling the car autonomously.

During my time in university I build several projects in university and in free time with friends with more complex programs. One example was a signal processing application that used a microphone to detect clapping.

ADvZmUmt4I0d7phXaKoB.description: I use the Arduino platform for a lot of my side projects and have knowledge in sensor communication and serial protocols.
ADvZmUmt4I0d7phXaKoB.title: Arduino

changes.text: Drawing from previous experience and a wide network of DevOps practicioners I strongly influenced our teams decision regarding team setup, development processes and priority of component development. This meant bridging classic automotive processes to a DevOps mindset.

Being responsible for a joint development mindset for a team of ~10 developers I often came back to things like [DevOps Topologies](https://web.devopstopologies.com/) to find possible solutions to issues in our working mode. Spanning multiple products and technical skillsets resulted in a more generic view of DevOps practices in general instead of mapping them directly to explicit problems for a given product development.

Starting development with a PaaS cloud lead to an increased complexity regarding solution architecture (microservices) and deployment models. Rethinking our previous processes brought us back to the DevOps core principles and come up with a set of adapted guidelines.
Having experienced people consult our project quickly lead to very high standards regarding automation, operational responsibility and deployment patterns in our team.

BxFbPATg0LeX9hBU1yj5.description: I am a strong believer and evangelist of the DevOps mindset and have experience applying those principles in all stages of a product development lifecycle.
BxFbPATg0LeX9hBU1yj5.title: DevOps

changes.text: Introduced to it shortly in an AI nanodegree I used it in a few occassion for smaller side projects to detect movement in images, basic emotion detection etc.
I spent some time building a smart contract using truffle for the OpenMined project.

Gve3ejGqSsW0L2sqyHQv.description: Writing smart contracts and distributed applications.
Gve3ejGqSsW0L2sqyHQv.title: Ethereum

changes.text:
During a Hackathon in October 2018 within a group of 4 I was in charge of prototyping and developing a control interface for a ROS based humanoid robot arm by Festo. As an interface the ROS web bridge (web sockets) was used. This gave insights into how the framework is structured into topics, services etc as well as first experience in what a good ROS architecture looks like.

By delivering a working prototype with a valid new use case for the existing product we won the Festo challenge. The source code as well as a demo video can be found on the [R.I.C GitHub repository](https://github.com/anoff/ric)

L8pYp9SHVrnKfLcoBFyx.description: Using the [Robot Operating System](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robot_Operating_System) framework to control complex robots with various kinematic and sensoric interfaces.
L8pYp9SHVrnKfLcoBFyx.title: ROS

changes.text: I built several smaller web UIs using vue in 2018. Got into concepts like vuex and data stores to some extent but never used it in larger codebases.
After building multiple web apps in Vue, especially the editor and teams app for #devradar I grow quite familiar with Vue.js. Both in JavaScript and Typescript.

OAkQXbtK9vgvVSoxgkGC.description: My main use of python is in the context of datascience and deep learning as well as computer vision. List comprehensions are my favorite üòá

changes.text: Building several automation scripts working with Microsoft365 API, Web Automation via Selenium. Polishing up my software engineering knowledge in the Python ecosystem with `pydocstyle`, `pyunit`, `pycodestyle` and typing with `mypy` including automation via GitHub Actions. Learned a lot about latest Python 3 features and renewed my Class knowledge.
I developed a deeper understanding of the Python language and its patterns through two Udacity nanodegree programs in the field of AI
Interested in data analytics I started using python and analytics libraries like scikitlearn or numpy to analyze different personal datasets.
Building and executing a Python Training for newcomers. Due to COVID fully remote with ~20 participants. 8 lessons of 2.5 hours each.

Participating in the #adventOfCode2018 in a joint [social coding project](https://github.com/anoff/aoc-2018) I solved each day using go and [learned more](https://aoc-2018.netlify.com/#_today_i_learned) about the language each day.

OEG7YTfqbOMyRycCZOSb.description: Mainly using Go for pet projects in backend space or data handling.
OEG7YTfqbOMyRycCZOSb.title: go

changes.text: Focusing on PaaS and serverless based solutions I have built applications using most of the base services. Large focus on JavaScript based functions and solution architecture.
First complete solution architecture for a service on Azure using managed only services.
First contact with Azure and figuring out how to host a Node.js application. Did a [presentation](https://github.com/anoff/azure-fns-demo) at the Node.js meetup about Azure functions.

changes.text: Migrating multiple services at work and from my private portfolio across CI services like GitLab, Drone, Travis, Circle CI and Azure Pipelines I am familiar with a wide range of services and best practice patterns how to implement pipelines as code.
Several years experience implementing automated tests, code analysis and deployment using various platforms.
Introducing automated testing and build to a Node.js project using Jenkins.

Learning the basics of testing in general. Developing test guidelines, environments and test cases for ECU software. My main goal was already then to automate as much as possible and being able to create reproducable results.
Extensively using GitHub Actions for my private & work projects
Several months working with the Azure provider, building modules, working with remote levels etc.
Using a lot of deployment for Azure functions I created and published my first [Terraform module for Azure functions](https://github.com/anoff/terraform-azurerm-functionapp)

changes.text:
After doing software and solution architecture for several years in multiple domains (ECU, software, cloud solutions) I decided to get an introduction into the _official_ world of software architecture by visiting a 4 day onsite training by the german company Oose that specialices in IT trainings.
As expected the training helped me structure my existing tools and approaches towards problem solving by putting individual architectural steps like definition of constraints, system context, component/deployment views into relation with each other and giving me a better idea which stakeholders are responsible to develop the individual artefacts.

Yz1i97fvTzu3RHVxJMiA.description: A structured approach to solving problems.
Yz1i97fvTzu3RHVxJMiA.title: Software Architecture

changes.text: Setting up and operating a multi-machine development environment on Azure gave me a lot new insights into using Docker and docker-compose to run applications with minimal bootstrapping of the VM.
Using Docker heavily to guarantee consistent software behavior across various developer machines as well as production systems. By this time I maintain several Docker images - most based on Node.js.
Becoming a Docker _user_ at work, running images provided by others with slight modifications and some custom builds.

dPcRr6aHFWhyYyfVtvGY.description:
Container technology used for running various tools on my local machine without having to install plethora of compilers and drivers.
Also used for hosting services on Virtual Machines.
dPcRr6aHFWhyYyfVtvGY.title: Docker
